t: Hosea 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Hosea the son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and*i Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.
The Family of Hosea

When*p the Lord*s began to speak by Hosea, the Lord*s said to Hosea: “Go,*pn take yourself a wife of harlotry And*ld children of harlotry, For*ld the land has committed great harlotry By*ild departing*i from the Lord.”*s
So*p he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.

Then the Lord*s said to him: “Call*pn his name Jezreel, For*ld in a little while*i I*ld will avenge the bloodshed of Jezreel on the house of Jehu, And*ld bring an end to the kingdom of the house of Israel.
It*ld shall come to pass in that day That*ld I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.”
And*p she conceived again and bore a daughter. Then God*i said to him: “Call*pn her name Lo-Ruhamah, For*ld I will no longer have mercy on the house of Israel, But*ld I will utterly take them away.
Yet*ld I will have mercy on the house of Judah, Will*ld save them by the Lord*s their God, And*ld will not save them by bow, Nor*ld by sword or battle, By*ld horses or horsemen.”
Now*p when she had weaned Lo-Ruhamah, she conceived and bore a son.
Then God*i said: “Call*pn his name Lo-Ammi, For*ld you are*i not My people, And*ld I will not be your God.*i
The Restoration of Israel

“Yet*pn the number of the children of Israel Shall*ld be as the sand of the sea, Which*ld cannot be measured or numbered. And*ld it shall come to pass In*ld the place where it was said to them, ‘You*ld are*i not My people,’ There*ild it shall be said to them, ‘You*ild are*i sons of the living God.’

Then*ld the children of Judah and the children of Israel Shall*ld be gathered together, And*ld appoint for themselves one head; And*ld they shall come up out of the land, For*ld great will*i be*i the day of Jezreel!
Hosea 2
Say*pn to your brethren, ‘My people,’ And*ld to your sisters, ‘Mercy is*i shown.’*i
God’s Unfaithful People

“Bring*pn charges against your mother, bring charges; For*ld she is*i not My wife, nor am*i I her Husband! Let*ld her put away her harlotries from her sight, And*ld her adulteries from between her breasts;
Lest*ld I strip her naked And*ld expose her, as in the day she was born, And*ld make her like a wilderness, And*ld set her like a dry land, And*ld slay her with thirst.
“I*ln will not have mercy on her children, For*ld they are*i the children of harlotry.

For*ld their mother has played the harlot; She*ld who conceived them has behaved shamefully. For*ld she said, ‘I will go after my lovers, Who*ld give me*i my bread and my water, My*ld wool and my linen, My*ld oil and my drink.’
“Therefore,*ln behold, I*ld will hedge up your way with thorns, And*ld wall her in, So*ld that she cannot find her paths.

She*ld will chase her lovers, But*ld not overtake them; Yes,*ld she will seek them, but not find them.*i Then*ld she will say, ‘I*ld will go and return to my first husband, For*ld then it*i was*i better for me than now.’
For*ld she did not know That*ld I gave her grain, new wine, and oil, And*ld multiplied her silver and gold— Which*ild they prepared for Baal.
“Therefore*ln I will return and take away My*ld grain in its time And*ld My new wine in its season, And*ld will take back My wool and My linen, Given*ild to cover her nakedness.
Now*ld I will uncover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers, And*ld no one shall deliver her from My hand.
I*ld will also cause all her mirth to cease, Her*ld feast days, Her*ld New Moons, Her*ld Sabbaths— All*ld her appointed feasts.

“And*ln I will destroy her vines and her fig trees, Of*ld which she has said, ‘These*ld are*i my wages that my lovers have given me.’ So*ld I will make them a forest, And*ld the beasts of the field shall eat them.

I*ld will punish her For*ld the days of the Baals to which she burned incense. She*ld decked herself with her earrings and jewelry, And*ld went after her lovers; But*ld Me she forgot,” says the Lord.*s
God’s Mercy on His People
“Therefore,*pn behold, I will allure her, Will*ld bring her into the wilderness, And*ld speak comfort to her.

I*ld will give her her vineyards from there, And*ld the Valley of Achor as a door of hope; She*ld shall sing there, As*ld in the days of her youth, As*ld in the day when she came up from the land of Egypt.
“And*ln it shall be, in that day,” Says*ld the Lord,*s “That*ild you will call Me ‘My Husband,’ And*ld no longer call Me ‘My Master,’
For*ld I will take from her mouth the names of the Baals, And*ld they shall be remembered by their name no more.

In*ld that day I will make a covenant for them With*ld the beasts of the field, With*ld the birds of the air, And*ld with*i the creeping things of the ground. Bow*ld and sword of battle I will shatter from the earth, To*ld make them lie down safely.
“I*ln will betroth you to Me forever; Yes,*ld I will betroth you to Me In*ld righteousness and justice, In*ld lovingkindness and mercy;
I*ld will betroth you to Me in faithfulness, And*ld you shall know the Lord.*s
“It*ln shall come to pass in that day That*ild I will answer,” says the Lord;*s “I*ld will answer the heavens, And*ld they shall answer the earth.
The*ld earth shall answer With*ld grain, With*ld new wine, And*ld with oil; They*ld shall answer Jezreel.

Then*ld I will sow her for Myself in the earth, And*ld I will have mercy on her*i who*i had*i not obtained mercy; Then*ld I will say to those*i who*i were*i not My people, ‘You*ld are*i My people!’ And*ld they shall say, ‘You*i are*i my God!’”
Hosea 3
Israel Will Return to God

Then*p the Lord*s said to me, “Go again, love a woman who*i is*i loved by a lover and is committing adultery, just like the love of the Lord*s for the children of Israel, who look to other gods and love the*i raisin cakes of*i the*i pagans.”*i
So*p I bought her for myself for fifteen shekels*i of silver, and one and one-half homers of barley.
And I said to her, “You shall stay with me many days; you shall not play the harlot, nor shall you have a man—so, too, will*i I be*i toward you.”
For*p the children of Israel shall abide many days without king or prince, without sacrifice or sacred*i pillar, without ephod or teraphim.
Afterward the children of Israel shall return and seek the Lord*s their God and David their king. They shall fear the Lord*s and His goodness in the latter days.
Hosea 4
God’s Charge Against Israel
Hear*pn the word of the Lord,*s You*ld children of Israel, For*ld the Lord*s brings*i a charge against the inhabitants of the land: “There*ln is no truth or mercy Or*ld knowledge of God in the land.
By*ild swearing and lying, Killing*ld and stealing and committing adultery, They*ld break all restraint, With*ld bloodshed upon bloodshed.
Therefore*ld the land will mourn; And*ld everyone who dwells there will waste away With*ld the beasts of the field And*ld the birds of the air; Even*ld the fish of the sea will be taken away.
“Now*ln let no man contend, or rebuke another; For*ld your people are*i like those who contend with the priest.
Therefore*ld you shall stumble in the day; The*ld prophet also shall stumble with you in the night; And*ld I will destroy your mother.

My*ld people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. Because*ld you have rejected knowledge, I*ld also will reject you from being priest for Me; Because*ld you have forgotten the law of your God, I*ld also will forget your children.
“The*ln more they increased, The*ld more they sinned against Me; I*ld will change their glory into shame.
They*ld eat up the sin of My people; They*ld set their heart on their iniquity.
And*ld it shall be: like people, like priest. So*ld I will punish them for their ways, And*ld reward them for their deeds.
For*ld they shall eat, but not have enough; They*ld shall commit harlotry, but not increase; Because*ld they have ceased obeying the Lord.*s
The Idolatry of Israel
“Harlotry,*pn wine, and new wine enslave the heart.
My*ld people ask counsel from their wooden idols,*i And*ld their staff informs them. For*ld the spirit of harlotry has caused them*i to stray, And*ld they have played the harlot against their God.

They*ld offer sacrifices on the mountaintops, And*ld burn incense on the hills, Under*ld oaks, poplars, and terebinths, Because*ld their shade is*i good. Therefore*ld your daughters commit harlotry, And*ld your brides commit adultery.

“I*ln will not punish your daughters when they commit harlotry, Nor*ld your brides when they commit adultery; For*ld the*i men*i themselves go apart with harlots, And*ld offer sacrifices with a ritual harlot. Therefore*ld people who*i do not understand will be trampled.
“Though*ln you, Israel, play the harlot, Let*ld not Judah offend. Do*ld not come up to Gilgal, Nor*ld go up to Beth Aven, Nor*ld swear an oath, saying,*i ‘As the Lord*s lives’—
“For*ln Israel is stubborn Like*ld a stubborn calf; Now*ld the Lord*s will let them forage Like*ld a lamb in open country.
“Ephraim*ln is*i joined to idols, Let*ld him alone.
Their*ld drink is rebellion, They*ld commit harlotry continually. Her*ld rulers dearly love dishonor.
The*ld wind has wrapped her up in its wings, And*ld they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
Hosea 5
Impending Judgment on Israel and Judah
“Hear*pn this, O priests! Take*ld heed, O house of Israel! Give*ld ear, O house of the king! For*ld yours is*i the judgment, Because*ld you have been a snare to Mizpah And*ld a net spread on Tabor.
The*ld revolters are deeply involved in slaughter, Though*ld I rebuke them all.
I*ld know Ephraim, And*ld Israel is not hidden from Me; For*ld now, O Ephraim, you commit harlotry; Israel*ld is defiled.
“They*ln do not direct their deeds Toward*ld turning to their God, For*ld the spirit of harlotry is in their midst, And*ld they do not know the Lord.*s
The*ld pride of Israel testifies to his face; Therefore*ld Israel and Ephraim stumble in their iniquity; Judah*ld also stumbles with them.
“With*ln their flocks and herds They*ld shall go to seek the Lord,*s But*ld they will not find Him;*i He*ld has withdrawn Himself from them.
They*ld have dealt treacherously with the Lord,*s For*ld they have begotten pagan children. Now*ld a New Moon shall devour them and their heritage.
“Blow*ln the ram’s horn in Gibeah, The*ld trumpet in Ramah! Cry*ld aloud at*i Beth Aven, ‘Look*ild behind you, O Benjamin!’
Ephraim*ld shall be desolate in the day of rebuke; Among*ld the tribes of Israel I make known what is sure.
“The*ln princes of Judah are like those who remove a landmark; I*ld will pour out My wrath on them like water.
Ephraim*ld is oppressed and*i broken in judgment, Because*ld he willingly walked by human*i precept.
Therefore*ld I will*i be*i to Ephraim like a moth, And*ld to the house of Judah like rottenness.
“When*ln Ephraim saw his sickness, And*ld Judah saw*i his wound, Then*ld Ephraim went to Assyria And*ld sent to King Jareb; Yet*ld he cannot cure you, Nor*ld heal you of your wound.
For*ld I will*i be*i like a lion to Ephraim, And*ld like a young lion to the house of Judah. I,*ld even*i I, will tear them*i and go away; I*ld will take them*i away, and no one shall rescue.
I*ld will return again to My place Till*ld they acknowledge their offense. Then*ld they will seek My face; In*ld their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.”
Hosea 6
A Call to Repentance
Come,*pn and let us return to the Lord;*s For*ld He has torn, but He will heal us; He*ld has stricken, but He will bind us up.
After*ld two days He will revive us; On*ld the third day He will raise us up, That*ld we may live in His sight.
Let*ld us know, Let*ld us pursue the knowledge of the Lord.*s His*ld going forth is established as the morning; He*ld will come to us like the rain, Like*ld the latter and*i former rain to the earth.
Impenitence of Israel and Judah
“O*pn Ephraim, what shall I do to you? O*ld Judah, what shall I do to you? For*ld your faithfulness is like a morning cloud, And*ld like the early dew it goes away.
Therefore*ld I have hewn them*i by the prophets, I*ld have slain them by the words of My mouth; And*ld your judgments are*i like*i light that*i goes forth.
For*ld I desire mercy and not sacrifice, And*ld the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
“But*ln like men they transgressed the covenant; There*ld they dealt treacherously with Me.
Gilead*ld is*i a city of evildoers And*ild defiled with blood.
As*ld bands of robbers lie in wait for a man, So*ild the company of priests murder on the way to Shechem; Surely*ld they commit lewdness.
I*ld have seen a horrible thing in the house of Israel: There*ld is*i the harlotry of Ephraim; Israel*ld is defiled.
Also,*ld O Judah, a harvest is appointed for you, When*ld I return the captives of My people.
Hosea 7

“When*pn I would have healed Israel, Then*ld the iniquity of Ephraim was uncovered, And*ld the wickedness of Samaria. For*ld they have committed fraud; A*ld thief comes in; A*ld band of robbers takes spoil outside.
They*ld do not consider in their hearts That*ild I remember all their wickedness; Now*ld their own deeds have surrounded them; They*ld are before My face.
They*ld make a king glad with their wickedness, And*ld princes with their lies.
“They*ln are*i all adulterers. Like*ld an oven heated by a baker— He*ld ceases stirring the*i fire*i after kneading the dough, Until*ld it is leavened.
In*ld the day of our king Princes*ld have made him*i sick, inflamed with wine; He*ld stretched out his hand with scoffers.
They*ld prepare their heart like an oven, While*ld they lie in wait; Their*ld baker sleeps all night; In*ld the morning it burns like a flaming fire.
They*ld are all hot, like an oven, And*ld have devoured their judges; All*ld their kings have fallen. None*ld among them calls upon Me.
“Ephraim*ln has mixed himself among the peoples; Ephraim*ld is a cake unturned.
Aliens*ld have devoured his strength, But*ld he does not know it;*i Yes,*ld gray hairs are here and there on him, Yet*ld he does not know it.*i
And*ld the pride of Israel testifies to his face, But*ld they do not return to the Lord*s their God, Nor*ld seek Him for all this.
Futile Reliance on the Nations
“Ephraim*pn also is like a silly dove, without sense— They*ld call to Egypt, They*ld go to Assyria.
Wherever*ld they go, I will spread My net on them; I*ld will bring them down like birds of the air; I*ld will chastise them According*ld to what their congregation has heard.
“Woe*ln to them, for they have fled from Me! Destruction*ld to them, Because*ld they have transgressed against Me! Though*ld I redeemed them, Yet*ld they have spoken lies against Me.
They*ld did not cry out to Me with their heart When*ld they wailed upon their beds. “They*ln assemble together for grain and new wine, They*ld rebel against Me;
Though*ld I disciplined and*i strengthened their arms, Yet*ld they devise evil against Me;

They*ld return, but*i not to the Most High; They*ld are like a treacherous bow. Their*ld princes shall fall by the sword For*ld the cursings of their tongue. This*ld shall*i be*i their derision in the land of Egypt.
Hosea 8
The Apostasy of Israel
“Set*ipn the trumpet to your mouth! He*ild shall*i come*i like an eagle against the house of the Lord,*s Because*ld they have transgressed My covenant And*ld rebelled against My law.
Israel*ld will cry to Me, ‘My*ld God, we know You!’
Israel*ld has rejected the good; The*ld enemy will pursue him.
“They*ln set up kings, but not by Me; They*ld made princes, but I did not acknowledge them.*i From*ld their silver and gold They*ld made idols for themselves— That*ld they might be cut off.
Your*ld calf is rejected, O Samaria! My*ld anger is aroused against them— How*ld long until they attain to innocence?
For*ld from Israel is*i even this: A*ld workman made it, and it is*i not God; But*ld the calf of Samaria shall be broken to pieces.
“They*ln sow the wind, And*ld reap the whirlwind. The*ld stalk has no bud; It*ld shall never produce meal. If*ld it should produce, Aliens*ld would swallow it up.
Israel*ld is swallowed up; Now*ld they are among the Gentiles Like*ld a vessel in which is*i no pleasure.
For*ld they have gone up to Assyria, Like*ild a wild donkey alone by itself; Ephraim*ld has hired lovers.
Yes,*ld though they have hired among the nations, Now*ld I will gather them; And*ld they shall sorrow a little, Because*ld of the burden of the king of princes.
“Because*ln Ephraim has made many altars for sin, They*ld have become for him altars for sinning.
I*ld have written for him the great things of My law, But*ild they were considered a strange thing.

For*ild the sacrifices of My offerings they sacrifice flesh and eat it,*i But*ild the Lord*s does not accept them. Now*ld He will remember their iniquity and punish their sins. They*ld shall return to Egypt.
“For*ln Israel has forgotten his Maker, And*ld has built temples; Judah*ld also has multiplied fortified cities; But*ld I will send fire upon his cities, And*ld it shall devour his palaces.”
Hosea 9
Judgment of Israel’s Sin
Do*pn not rejoice, O Israel, with joy like other*i peoples, For*ld you have played the harlot against your God. You*ld have made love for*i hire on every threshing floor.
The*ld threshing floor and the winepress Shall*ld not feed them, And*ld the new wine shall fail in her.
They*ln shall not dwell in the Lord’s*s land, But*ld Ephraim shall return to Egypt, And*ld shall eat unclean things*i in Assyria.

They*ld shall not offer wine offerings*i to the Lord,*s Nor*ld shall their sacrifices be pleasing to Him. It*ild shall*i be*i like bread of mourners to them; All*ld who eat it shall be defiled. For*ld their bread shall*i be*i for their own*i life; It*ld shall not come into the house of the Lord.*s
What*ln will you do in the appointed day, And*ld in the day of the feast of the Lord?*s

For*ld indeed they are gone because of destruction. Egypt*ld shall gather them up; Memphis*ld shall bury them. Nettles*ld shall possess their valuables of silver; Thorns*ld shall*i be*i in their tents.

The*ln days of punishment have come; The*ld days of recompense have come. Israel*ld knows! The*ld prophet is*i a fool, The*ld spiritual man is*i insane, Because*ld of the greatness of your iniquity and great enmity.
The*ld watchman of Ephraim is*i with my God; But*ld the prophet is*i a fowler’s snare in all his ways— Enmity*ld in the house of his God.
They*ld are deeply corrupted, As*ld in the days of Gibeah. He*ld will remember their iniquity; He*ld will punish their sins.

“I*ln found Israel Like*ld grapes in the wilderness; I*ld saw your fathers As*ld the firstfruits on the fig tree in its first season. But*ild they went to Baal Peor, And*ld separated themselves to*i that*i shame; They*ld became an abomination like the thing they loved.
As*ild for*i Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird— No*ld birth, no pregnancy, and no conception!
Though*ld they bring up their children, Yet*ld I will bereave them to the last man. Yes,*ld woe to them when I depart from them!
Just*ld as I saw Ephraim like Tyre, planted in a pleasant place, So*ld Ephraim will bring out his children to the murderer.”
Give*ln them, O Lord—*s What*ld will You give? Give*ld them a miscarrying womb And*ld dry breasts!

“All*ln their wickedness is*i in Gilgal, For*ld there I hated them. Because*ld of the evil of their deeds I*ld will drive them from My house; I*ld will love them no more. All*ld their princes are*i rebellious.
Ephraim*ld is stricken, Their*ld root is dried up; They*ld shall bear no fruit. Yes,*ld were they to bear children, I*ld would kill the darlings of their womb.”
My*ln God will cast them away, Because*ld they did not obey Him; And*ld they shall be wanderers among the nations.
Hosea 10
Israel’s Sin and Captivity

Israel*pn empties his*i vine; He*ld brings forth fruit for himself. According*ld to the multitude of his fruit He*ld has increased the altars; According*ld to the bounty of his land They*ld have embellished his*i sacred*i pillars.
Their*ld heart is divided; Now*ld they are held guilty. He*ld will break down their altars; He*ld will ruin their sacred*i pillars.
For*ln now they say, “We*ld have no king, Because*ld we did not fear the Lord.*s And*ld as for a king, what would he do for us?”
They*ld have spoken words, Swearing*ld falsely in making a covenant. Thus*ld judgment springs up like hemlock in the furrows of the field.
The*ln inhabitants of Samaria fear Because*ld of the calf of Beth Aven. For*ld its people mourn for it, And*ld its priests shriek for it— Because*ld its glory has departed from it.
The*ild idol*i also shall be carried to Assyria As*ild a present for King Jareb. Ephraim*ld shall receive shame, And*ld Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
As*iln for*i Samaria, her king is cut off Like*ld a twig on the water.

Also*ld the high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, Shall*ld be destroyed. The*ld thorn and thistle shall grow on their altars; They*ld shall say to the mountains, “Cover us!” And*ld to the hills, “Fall on us!”
“O*ln Israel, you have sinned from the days of Gibeah; There*ld they stood. The*ld battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity Did*ld not overtake them.
When*ld it*i is*i My desire, I will chasten them. Peoples*ld shall be gathered against them When*ld I bind them for their two transgressions.
Ephraim*ld is*i a trained heifer That*ld loves to thresh grain;*i But*ld I harnessed her fair neck, I*ld will make Ephraim pull a*i plow.*i Judah*ld shall plow; Jacob*ld shall break his clods.”
Sow*ln for yourselves righteousness; Reap*ld in mercy; Break*ld up your fallow ground, For*ld it*i is*i time to seek the Lord,*s Till*ld He comes and rains righteousness on you.
You*ln have plowed wickedness; You*ld have reaped iniquity. You*ld have eaten the fruit of lies, Because*ld you trusted in your own way, In*ld the multitude of your mighty men.

Therefore*ld tumult shall arise among your people, And*ld all your fortresses shall be plundered As*ld Shalman plundered Beth Arbel in the day of battle— A*ld mother dashed in pieces upon her*i children.
Thus*ld it shall be done to you, O Bethel, Because*ld of your great wickedness. At*ld dawn the king of Israel Shall*ld be cut off utterly.
Hosea 11
God’s Continuing Love for Israel
“When*pn Israel was*i a child, I loved him, And*ld out of Egypt I called My son.
As*ild they called them, So*ld they went from them; They*ld sacrificed to the Baals, And*ld burned incense to carved images.
“I*ln taught Ephraim to walk, Taking*ld them by their arms; But*ld they did not know that I healed them.
I*ld drew them with gentle cords, With*ld bands of love, And*ld I was to them as those who take the yoke from their neck. I*ld stooped and*i fed them.
“He*ln shall not return to the land of Egypt; But*ld the Assyrian shall be his king, Because*ld they refused to repent.
And*ld the sword shall slash in his cities, Devour*ld his districts, And*ld consume them,*i Because*ld of their own counsels.
My*ld people are bent on backsliding from Me. Though*ld they call to the Most High, None*ld at all exalt Him.*i
“How*ln can I give you up, Ephraim? How*ild can I hand you over, Israel? How*ld can I make you like Admah? How*ild can I set you like Zeboiim? My*ld heart churns within Me; My*ld sympathy is stirred.
I*ld will not execute the fierceness of My anger; I*ld will not again destroy Ephraim. For*ld I am*i God, and not man, The*ld Holy One in your midst; And*ld I will not come with terror.
“They*ln shall walk after the Lord.*s He*ld will roar like a lion. When*ld He roars, Then*ld His*i sons shall come trembling from the west;
They*ld shall come trembling like a bird from Egypt, Like*ld a dove from the land of Assyria. And*ld I will let them dwell in their houses,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
God’s Charge Against Ephraim
“Ephraim*pn has encircled Me with lies, And*ld the house of Israel with deceit; But*ld Judah still walks with God, Even*ld with the Holy One who*i is*i faithful.
Hosea 12
“Ephraim*pn feeds on the wind, And*ld pursues the east wind; He*ld daily increases lies and desolation. Also*ld they make a covenant with the Assyrians, And*ld oil is carried to Egypt.
“The*ln Lord*s also brings*i a charge against Judah, And*ld will punish Jacob according to his ways; According*ld to his deeds He will recompense him.
He*ld took his brother by the heel in the womb, And*ld in his strength he struggled with God.
Yes,*ld he struggled with the Angel and prevailed; He*ld wept, and sought favor from Him. He*ld found Him in*i Bethel, And*ld there He spoke to us—
That*ld is, the Lord*s God of hosts. The*ld Lord*s is*i His memorable name.
So*ld you, by the*i help*i of*i your God, return; Observe*ld mercy and justice, And*ld wait on your God continually.
“A*ln cunning Canaanite! Deceitful*ld scales are*i in his hand; He*ld loves to oppress.
And*ld Ephraim said, ‘Surely*ld I have become rich, I*ld have found wealth for myself; In*ild all my labors They*ld shall find in me no iniquity that is*i sin.’
“But*ln I am*i the Lord*s your God, Ever*ld since the land of Egypt; I*ld will again make you dwell in tents, As*ld in the days of the appointed feast.
I*ld have also spoken by the prophets, And*ld have multiplied visions; I*ld have given symbols through the witness of the prophets.”
Though*ln Gilead has*i idols— Surely*ld they are vanity— Though*ld they sacrifice bulls in Gilgal, Indeed*ld their altars shall*i be*i heaps in the furrows of the field.
Jacob*ln fled to the country of Syria; Israel*ld served for a spouse, And*ld for a wife he tended sheep.*i
By*ld a prophet the Lord*s brought Israel out of Egypt, And*ld by a prophet he was preserved.
Ephraim*ld provoked Him*i to anger most bitterly; Therefore*ld his Lord will leave the guilt of his bloodshed upon him, And*ld return his reproach upon him.
Hosea 13
Relentless Judgment on Israel
When*pn Ephraim spoke, trembling, He*ld exalted himself*i in Israel; But*ld when he offended through Baal worship,*i he died.

Now*ld they sin more and more, And*ld have made for themselves molded images, Idols*ld of their silver, according to their skill; All*ld of it is*i the work of craftsmen. They*ld say of them, “Let*ld the men who sacrifice kiss the calves!”
Therefore*ld they shall be like the morning cloud And*ld like the early dew that passes away, Like*ld chaff blown off from a threshing floor And*ld like smoke from a chimney.
“Yet*ln I am*i the Lord*s your God Ever*ld since the land of Egypt, And*ld you shall know no God but Me; For*ld there*i is*i no savior besides Me.
I*ld knew you in the wilderness, In*ld the land of great drought.
When*ld they had pasture, they were filled; They*ld were filled and their heart was exalted; Therefore*ld they forgot Me.
“So*ln I will be to them like a lion; Like*ld a leopard by the road I will lurk;
I*ld will meet them like a bear deprived of*i her*i cubs;*i I*ld will tear open their rib cage, And*ld there I will devour them like a lion. The*ld wild beast shall tear them.
“O*ln Israel, you are destroyed, But*ld your help is*i from Me.

Hosea 14
Israel Restored at Last
O*pn Israel, return to the Lord*s your God, For*ld you have stumbled because of your iniquity;

“I*ln will heal their backsliding, I*ld will love them freely, For*ld My anger has turned away from him.
